news_header: Experts are returning to Syria's heritage sites like Palmyra and Crac des Chevaliers, aiming to restore them and revive tourism to boost the economy after years of war.
news_original_title: Experts return to Syria&#8217;s war-torn heritage sites, including Roman ruins at Palmyra
news_text: Despite the damage from conflict and looting, local tourists are visiting, and there are hopes for international tourism to return. Preservation efforts are needed, and UNESCO has been remotely supporting protection since 2015. Restoration will take time and requires trained teams to assess the sites.
